security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The skill operates in read-only mode, analyzing training artifacts to diagnose failures. All capabilities are transparent in documentation. No network calls, credential access, or malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: ML training often fails with unclear causes. This skill spawns a specialist agent that systematically analyzes training logs, loss curves, and model code to identify root causes like learning rate issues, mode collapse, or architecture problems.
actual_capabilities: Analyze training logs and loss curves for pathological patterns
Diagnose mode collapse, loss divergence, and gradient issues
Identify architecture imbalances in model parameters
Propose evidence-based fixes with confidence scores
limitations: Cannot modify code directly (read-only analysis only)
Requires training artifacts to be provided
Cannot access GPU or runtime training environment

use_cases.title: Debug Training Divergence
use_cases.description: Diagnose why loss started increasing at epoch 7 and identify the learning rate issue.

use_cases.title: Fix Mode Collapse
use_cases.description: Understand why model outputs only one token and how to rebalance architecture.

use_cases.title: Analyze Gradient Problems
use_cases.description: Investigate exploding or vanishing gradients in deep neural networks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Loss Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: My training loss is not decreasing. Analyze my training logs and help identify the root cause.

prompt_templates.title: Epoch Failure
prompt_templates.prompt: My model was training fine until epoch 7, then loss started increasing. Debug this.

prompt_templates.title: Model Output Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: My model only outputs the same token regardless of input. Help diagnose mode collapse.

prompt_templates.title: Full Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Debug my training failure. Symptoms: [describe]. Available artifacts: [list files]. Provide root cause analysis with evidence.

output_examples.input: My model only outputs colons (::::) regardless of input. Training loss decreased but outputs are degenerate.
output: Root Cause: Architecture imbalance - embedding layer has 79% of parameters
Evidence: Parameter count shows underparameterized transformer
Fix: Rebalance architecture to 50% embeddings, 50% transformers

best_practices: Provide training logs, loss curves, and model code for accurate diagnosis
Include error messages and symptom descriptions
Specify when failure occurred (epoch, step, iteration)
Request confidence levels and evidence for each diagnosis
anti_patterns: Asking for fixes without providing training artifacts
Expecting the skill to modify code directly
Requesting diagnosis without clear symptom description
Assuming the skill can access GPU or runtime environment

faq.question: What ML frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: Focuses on PyTorch but diagnosis methodology applies to any deep learning framework.

faq.question: What artifacts does the skill need to analyze?
faq.answer: Training logs, loss curves (CSV), model code, hyperparameter config, and error messages.

faq.question: Can this skill fix the issues it finds?
faq.answer: No, it provides diagnosis and recommendations. Use ml-expertise skill to implement fixes.

faq.question: Is my training data accessed?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes logs, metrics, and code. Training data is never accessed.

faq.question: What if the skill cannot diagnose the issue?
faq.answer: It will request specific artifacts or suggest escalation paths for complex issues.

faq.question: How is this different from general code debugging?
faq.answer: Specializes in ML-specific patterns: loss curves, gradients, optimizer dynamics, and architecture issues.
